alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 5:43PM PST until January 08 at 10:05AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain pushed the Newaukum River above flood stage on Thursday. Heavy rain in the area has ended. The river has crested and will continue to recede into Saturday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Newaukum River Near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 202.5 feet, flood waters will inundate many roads and residential and commercial areas along the Newaukum River and its forks. Flooding in some areas may be deep and hazardous especially near rivers. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include Jackson Hwy. and Tune, Rush, Sommerville, Griel, Hamilton, Tauscher, Guerrier, Kirkland, Macomber, Rice, Senn, Lucas Creek, Middle Fork and North Fork Roads. A stage of 202.5 feet on the Newaukum roughly corresponds to Phase 2 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 204.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM PST Friday was 205.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 196.5 feet Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 400 AM PST.
